back_cards.definition_en: To place something in a specific position
back_cards.example_en: She set the vase on the table carefully.
The team set a new sales target for the quarter.

back_cards.definition_en: To prepare or arrange something for use
back_cards.example_en: He set the tent up by the lake for camping.

back_cards.definition_en: To fix a time or date for an event
back_cards.example_en: They set the meeting for next Monday.

back_cards.definition_en: To adjust a device to a particular setting
back_cards.example_en: She set the thermostat to 72 degrees.

back_cards.definition_en: On or to the outer side of something
back_cards.example_en: The dog is waiting outside the door.

back_cards.definition_en: Beyond the boundaries of a place
back_cards.example_en: They parked their car outside the city.

back_cards.definition_en: Not within a particular group or organization
back_cards.example_en: She sought advice from someone outside the company.

back_cards.definition_en: In the open air or outdoors
back_cards.example_en: The kids played outside in the garden all day.
Outside of work, he enjoys hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to mean 'and' in Latin phrases or abbreviations
back_cards.example_en: The phrase 'et al.' means 'and others' in research papers.

back_cards.definition_en: Connecting items in a formal list
back_cards.example_en: The menu included soup, salad, et cetera.
The contract covered fees, taxes, et al.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in academic citations to include co-authors
back_cards.example_en: The study by Smith, Jones, et al. was groundbreaking.

back_cards.definition_en: Appearing in legal or formal contexts
back_cards.example_en: The agreement binds both parties, et ux.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan to achieve a long-term goal
back_cards.example_en: The company developed a strategy to increase market share.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to outmaneuver opponents in games
back_cards.example_en: Her chess strategy focused on controlling the center.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to address challenges in daily life
back_cards.example_en: His strategy for saving money was to cook at home.

back_cards.definition_en: A military plan for achieving victory
back_cards.example_en: The general's strategy involved a surprise attack.

back_cards.definition_en: An approach to improve performance in sports
back_cards.example_en: The coach's strategy relied on strong defense.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that is easy to understand
back_cards.example_en: She explained the problem clearly to the team.
He clearly won the debate with strong arguments.

back_cards.definition_en: In a distinct or obvious manner
back_cards.example_en: The stars were clearly visible in the night sky.
The teacher spoke clearly during the lecture.

back_cards.definition_en: In a straightforward or honest way
back_cards.example_en: She clearly expressed her concerns about the plan.

back_cards.definition_en: Something owned, like land or a building
back_cards.example_en: They bought a property by the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: A characteristic or quality of something
back_cards.example_en: Water has the property of being transparent.

back_cards.definition_en: Items used in a performance or film
back_cards.example_en: The theater stored props in the property room.
He invested all his savings in property.
The dispute was over property boundaries.
She lay the book on the desk.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrange or set something in place
back_cards.example_en: They lay the table for dinner every evening.
The hen lay three eggs this morning.

back_cards.definition_en: To put something in a flat position
back_cards.example_en: He lay the carpet in the living room.

back_cards.definition_en: To establish a foundation or basis
back_cards.example_en: Her research lay the groundwork for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Last in a series or process
back_cards.example_en: The final exam is next week.
They reached a final decision after hours of debate.
Her final goal was to run a marathon.
The judge's ruling was final.

back_cards.definition_en: Marking the end of a competition
back_cards.example_en: The team advanced to the final match.

back_cards.definition_en: The power to make decisions or enforce rules
back_cards.example_en: The principal has authority over school policies.
She is an authority on ancient history.
The city authority approved the new park.

back_cards.definition_en: Confidence in one's actions or speech
back_cards.example_en: He spoke with authority during the meeting.
The police had authority to search the house.
Her presentation was perfect and engaging.
This spot is perfect for a picnic.
The silence in the forest was perfect.

back_cards.definition_en: Ideal or excellent in every way
back_cards.example_en: They found the perfect house to buy.
Her technique was perfect after years of practice.

back_cards.definition_en: A systematic way of doing something
back_cards.example_en: Her teaching method engaged all students.

back_cards.definition_en: A procedure used in scientific research
back_cards.example_en: The experiment followed a strict method.
He used a new method to fix the code.
Her method for organizing files saved time.
The artist’s method involved bold colors.
The wine comes from the Tuscany region.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a country or the world
back_cards.example_en: This region is known for its forests.
The pain was in the abdominal region.
She manages the sales region for Asia.
The coastal region has mild winters.

back_cards.definition_en: From a specific time in the past until now
back_cards.example_en: She has lived here since 2015.

back_cards.definition_en: After a particular event or time
back_cards.example_en: He’s been happier since the promotion.

back_cards.definition_en: Because or as a result of
back_cards.example_en: Since it’s raining, we’ll stay inside.
Much has changed since her visit.
The shop has been open since morning.
The new law had a big impact on businesses.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of one object hitting another
back_cards.example_en: The car’s impact dented the wall.

back_cards.definition_en: A significant change in a situation
back_cards.example_en: Her speech had an impact on the audience.
The factory’s impact on the river was studied.
His leadership had an impact on the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To show or point out something
back_cards.example_en: The sign indicates the way to the park.
Her smile indicated she was happy.

back_cards.definition_en: To signal an intention or action
back_cards.example_en: He indicated a left turn while driving.
She indicated her preference for tea.
The test results indicate a problem.
The beach is safe for swimming today.
Keep your valuables in a safe place.
Her advice is always safe to follow.
He chose the safe option during the game.
They were safe after the storm passed.

back_cards.definition_en: A group formed to make decisions
back_cards.example_en: The committee approved the new budget.
She joined the festival committee.
The committee reviewed the building plans.
The safety committee met monthly.
The ethics committee issued a report.

back_cards.definition_en: Expected or required to do something
back_cards.example_en: You’re supposed to call before visiting.

back_cards.definition_en: Believed or assumed to be true
back_cards.example_en: He’s supposed to be an expert.
The event was supposed to start at 6.
She’s supposed to finish the report today.
The supposed thief was never caught.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of thoughts or images during sleep
back_cards.example_en: She had a dream about flying last night.
His dream is to become a doctor.
Living by the sea is her dream.
The plan sounded like a dream.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of being lost in thought
back_cards.example_en: He was in a dream during the lecture.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of learning job skills
back_cards.example_en: New employees need safety training.
Her marathon training was intense.
The dog underwent obedience training.
His medical training took years.
The company offered leadership training.
The dog left shit on the lawn.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for nonsense or lies
back_cards.example_en: Don’t believe his shit about winning.
We’re in deep shit with this delay.
All his stuff was just shit.
Oh shit, I forgot my keys!

back_cards.definition_en: Located in the middle of something
back_cards.example_en: The park is in central London.
Cost was the central issue in the talks.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a main system or hub
back_cards.example_en: The central office handles all complaints.

back_cards.definition_en: Core to an idea or process
back_cards.example_en: Trust is central to their friendship.
The city is central to the state’s economy.
She had the option to stay or leave.
Buying a used car is a good option.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature in technology or products
back_cards.example_en: The app has a dark mode option.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial contract for future purchase
back_cards.example_en: He bought options on the stock market.

back_cards.definition_en: A selectable item in a plan
back_cards.example_en: The menu had a vegan option.
She has eight cats in her house.

back_cards.definition_en: A group or set of eight
back_cards.example_en: The team played with eight members.

back_cards.definition_en: The eighth hour of the day
back_cards.example_en: The store opens at eight in the morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A card or score of eight
back_cards.example_en: He drew an eight in the card game.
The recipe needs eight ounces of flour.
She was particularly fond of the old house.
This winter was particularly cold.
He didn’t like crowds, particularly at malls.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that stands out
back_cards.example_en: Her speech was particularly inspiring.
The room was completely dark after the power outage.
She completely redesigned her website.
He completely forgot about the meeting.
They completely trusted their new coach.
The project was completely done by Friday.
Her opinion on the movie was positive.

back_cards.definition_en: A view shared by a group
back_cards.example_en: Public opinion favored the new law.
The doctor gave an opinion on the injury.
His opinion differed from the team’s.
The critic’s opinion influenced sales.
The main reason for the delay was rain.
The main entrance is at the front.

back_cards.definition_en: Leading in a system or process
back_cards.example_en: The main pipe supplies water to the house.

back_cards.definition_en: The main plot of the book was thrilling.
Key in a group or activity
back_cards.example_maine: She’s the main organizer of the event.

back_cards.example_en: He scored ten points in the quiz.
She bought ten apples at the market.
The race ended at ten seconds.

definition_en: A bill or note worth ten
example_en: He paid with a ten for the coffee.
The fabric was ten feet long.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal meeting to discuss a job qualifications
back_cards.example_en: She prepared for her job interview.

example_en.example_en: The actor gave an interview to a magazine.

definition_en: A research discussion to gather information
example_en: The survey included an interview with locals.
His interview with with the board went well.
The interview with the author aired last night.

back_cards.example_en: Dinosaurs no longer exist on Earth.

example_en.definition_en: To live or survive in conditions
example_en.example_en: Some plants exist in harsh deserts.

example_en: A solution exists for this issue.
Her talent exists in every performance.

back_cards.definition_en: To take something away or off from a place
back_cards.example_en: She removed the stain from her shirt.

example_en.definition_en: To eliminate or get rid of
example_en.example_en: They removed the old rule from the policy.

example_en: The board removed the CEO last month.
He removed a thorn from his finger.
She removed her shoes at the door.

back_cards.example_en: The room was too dark to read in.

example_en.example_en: She wore a dark blue coat.

example_en: The movie had a dark theme.
It gets dark early in winter.
He was in a dark mood after the news.

back_cards.definition_en: To engage in for fun or recreation
back_cards.example_en: The children play soccer in every park.

example_en.definition_en: To perform music on an instrument
example_en.example_en: She plays piano for the choir.

definition_en: To act in a role in a drama
example_en: He plays Hamlet in the new production.
definition_en: To use or operate in a game
To start or show something recorded media
example_en: Play the video for the class.

back_cards.definition_en: An organization of for workers’ rights
back_cards.example_en: The union negotiated for higher wages.

example_en.definition_en: A group of states or countries united
example_en.example_en: The European Union met to discuss trade.

definition_en: The act of joining or uniting
example_en: Their marriage was a happy union.
The union of clubs raised funds.
The union of two kingdoms lasted centuries.

back_cards.definition_en: A senior academic at a university
back_cards.example_en: The professor lectured on physics.

example_en.definition_en: An expert teacher in a field

definition_en: A title for high academic rank
example_en: He became a professor at age 40.
definition_en: A speaker at an academic event
example_en: The professor spoke at the conference.

back_cards.example_en: The pressure in the tire was low.

example_en.example_en: She felt pressure before the exam.

definition_en: Influence to act a certain way
example_en: The pressure to finish was intense.
The pressure dropped before the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: The reason for doing something exists
back_cards.example_en: The purpose of the meeting was unclear.

example_en.example_en: Her purpose was to help others.

example_en: This tool has a specific purpose.
He worked with purpose and focus.

back_cards.example_en: The band took the stage at 9 PM.

example_en.example_en: The project is in its final stage.

example_en: The child is in an early stage.
The debate stage was set up yesterday.
They reached the next stage of the tournament.

back_cards.definition_en: Having the color of the sky
back_cards.example_en: She wore a bright blue scarf.

example_en.example_en: He was feeling blue after the breakup.

example_en: The state is a blue-leaning region.
Her lips were blue from the chill.

back_cards.definition_en: Reflexive form of a female person
back_cards.example_en: She taught herself to code.

example_en.definition_en: Used for emphasis on a female subject

example_en: She fixed herself the car herself.
definition_en: Referring to a woman’s own identity
example_en: She was herself not herself yesterday.
She kept herself busy with work.

back_cards.definition_en: The star at Earth’s solar system
back_cards.example_en: The sun rose at 6 AM.

example_en.example_en: They sat in the sun all day.

definition_en: The light or heat from it
example_en: The sun dried the wet clothes.
definition_en: A symbol of life or energy
example_en: Her smile was like the sun.

back_cards.example_en: The pain in her knee was sharp.

example_en: The climb was worth the pain.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who of paints or draws
back_cards.example_en: The artist sketched the landscape.

example_en.definition_en: A performer in music or theater
example_en.example_en: She’s an artist with the orchestra.

example_en: The artist designed a stunning logo.
She’s an artist of modern cuisine.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who works for a company
back_cards.example_en: The employee received a bonus.

example_en.example_en: She’s an employee at the factory.

definition_en: A team member in an organization

back_cards.definition_en: To stay away or keep away from something
back_cards.example_en: Avoid the puddle on the floor.

example_en.example_en: She avoided a crash by braking.

definition_en: To steer clear of a person
example_en: She avoided her ex at the party.
They avoided trouble by leaving early.

back_cards.example_en: She checked her bank account.

example_en.definition_en: A user profile on a platform

example_en: His account of the event was vivid.
On account of rain, they canceled.

back_cards.example_en: They released the bird from the wild.

example_en.example_en: The band released a new song.

example_en: She released her grip on the rope.
He was released from his duties.

back_cards.definition_en: A pool of money for a purpose
back_cards.example_en: The fund supported local schools.

example_en: He invested in a pension fund.
They applied for a research fund.

back_cards.example_en: Protecting the environment is crucial.

example_en: The forest is a fragile environment.
The app runs in a secure environment.
Kids thrive in a safe environment.

back_cards.example_en: She treats her staff with respect.

example_en: They treat the wood with oil.
definition_en: To regard in a certain way

back_cards.example_en: She gave specific instructions.

example_en.example_en: This plant is specific to deserts.

example_en: He had a specific goal in mind.
The advice was specific to her case.
A specific type of fish was caught.

back_cards.definition_en: A variation of an original form
back_cards.example_en: This is the updated version of the app.

example_en.example_en: Her version of the story differed.

example_en: The movie is a version of the book.
He bought the latest version of the car.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of shooting a gun
back_cards.example_en: The hunter took a shot at the deer.

example_en.example_en: She took a great shot of the sunset.

example_en: He took a shot at the quiz.
His shot scored the winning goal.

back_cards.example_en: She hates getting up early.

example_en: They hate the idea of moving.
The rivals hate each other team.
I hate when it’s too crowded.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of things as they are
back_cards.example_en: Reality is often harsher than dreams.

example_en.example_en: The show blurs reality and fantasy.

example_en: The reality is we’re out of time.
The film captured the reality of war.

back_cards.example_en: She visits her grandma every Sunday.
She joined the chess club.

example_en: He swung the club at the ball.

back_cards.example_en: They demanded justice for the victim.

back_cards.definition_en: A large flowing body of water
back_cards.example_en: The river runs through the valley.

example_en.example_en: A river flows of cars passed.

back_cards.example_en: The brain processes information.

example_en.example_en: She’s the brain of the team.

example_en: Use your brain to solve it.

back_cards.example_en: Her memory of events was clear.

example_en: The statue is in his memory.
His memory for names is amazing.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of stone or mineral
back_cards.example_en: He skipped a rock on the lake.

example_en: Her ring has a huge rock.
The climbers scaled the rock face.

back_cards.example_en: They talk every evening.
She bought a new digital camera.
Climate change is a global issue.
She tried various flavors.

example_en: He had various reasons to stay.

back_cards.example_en: The train arrived on time.

example_en: She arrived as a top chef.

back_cards.example_en: She noticed a typo.

The puzzle was a challenge.
They had an argument.
She has lots of books.
Nobody was home.
The sword was his weapon.

The station was crowded.
They visited the island.
She absolutely loves it.
Take the bus instead.
The discussion was lively.
He walked instead.
The news affected her.

example_en.example_en: Her dress had a floral design.

example_en: It was by design, not chance.

back_cards.example_en: A little bird flew by.
